snippet: Duke Farms in Hillsborough, N.J., after a $45 million face-lift, has been turned into a secluded public park with a specific mission: Teach visitors to be good stewards of the environment.
abstract: Duke Farms, a former country estate in Hillsborough, NJ, belonging to heiress Doris Duke, has been transformed by the Doris Duke Charitable Foundation into a secluded public park intended to teach visitors to be good stewards of the environment; park, result of a $45 million renovation, is scheduled to open on May 19. Map, Photos (M)/
lead_paragraph: HILLSBOROUGH, N.J. TEENAGERS growing up in this part of Central New Jersey used to boast of how they had jumped the stone walls into Doris Duke's 2,740-acre estate here. How many actually made it past her private police force and how many merely bragged about doing so are lost to the haze of memory.

headline.main: An Oasis, Once Gilded, Now Greened
